# -*- mode: text -*-

product: JRE/JDK

vendor: Sun

license: Sun JRE/JDK "Binary Code License Agreement"

text: jdk.txt jre.txt jdk.readme.html jre.readme.txt

files: JDK/JRE binary downloads from Sun

notes: TBD: JRE or JDK. Readme files also have information about
       redistribution. Sun allows distribution of JRE/JDK, but here
       are our issues:

       <ul>

       <li><b>mirrors</b> can our binaries be redistributed by others
       - they will be restributing JRE/JDK

       <li><b>restrictions on binary customer</b> do any further
       restrictions get placed on binary downloading customer because
       we agreed to the Sun license

       <li><b>compatibility with other licenses</b> can we ship
       JDK/JRE bits along with all this other software licenses

       <li><b>source customer</b> we can not give JDK bits for a
       source download because the source download will be governed
       only by GPL?

       </ul>

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: JavaMail

vendor: Sun

license: Sun BCLA + JavaMail Supplement 

text: javamail.txt

files: mail.jar

notes: See JDK/JRE notes for Sun license issues

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: JNDI

vendor: Sun

license: Sun BCLA + JNDI Supplement

text: jndi.txt

files: ldapbp.jar ldap.jar

notes: These two files are required for development only.  Currently
       we plan to run on JDK 1.5, and these classes are already
       included in JRE 1.5. Right now we downloaded these files
       separately because most of our developers are running JDK
       1.4.x.  We also want to keep our option open for running on
       1.4.2, and we decide to do that, we will need to ship these
       files - they will not be dev only at that point - but chances
       are low of this happening.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: JSP JSTL

vendor: Sun

license: Sun JSTL (No Sun BCLA)

text: jstl.txt

files: jstl.jar

notes: See JDK/JRE notes for Sun license issues.  This file also ships
       with Tomcat, but does their (ASF/Tomcat's) license to
       redistribute transfer to us?

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: Java Activation Framework

vendor: Sun

license: Sun BCLA + Sun JAF Supplement

text: activation.txt

files: activation.jar

notes: See JDK/JRE notes for Sun license issues

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: JavaCC (for development only)

vendor: javacc.dev.java.net

license: BSD

text: javacc.txt

files: javacc-3.2.jar

notes: two orig authors + community.  Written while they worked at Sun
       so parts are copyright Sun.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: MySQL

vendor: MySQL

license: GPL

text: gpl.txt

files: mysql-standard tar.gz from MySQL.com

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: Tomcat

vendor: apache.org

license: Apache 2.0

text: apache2.txt

files: tar.gz from jakarta.apache.org, including catalina-ant.jar,
       servlet-api.jar

product: Postfix

vendor: postfix.org

license: CPL (IBM)

text: postfix.txt

files: built from postfix source distribution

notes: Weitse Venema/IBM

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: OpenLDAP

vendor: www.openldap.org

license: BSD

text: openldap.txt

files: built form openldap source distribution

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: Sleepycat Berkeley DB

vendor: www.sleepycat.com

license: SleepyCat + Berkeley + Harvard

text: sleepycat.txt

files: build from berkeley db source distribution

notes: when we charge money will we have to pay sleepycat?

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: Verity ExportSDK, FilterSDK

vendor: Verity

license: Proprietary

files: verity dlls, KeyView.jar

notes: needs to be packaged seperately - this library is linked into a
       standalone server that is used for document conversion and
       extraction.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

       commons-beanutils-1.6.1.jar
       commons-cli-1.0.jar
       commons-cli-2.0.jar 
       commons-codec-1.2.jar

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: dl.concurrent

vendor: gee.cs.oswego.edu/dl

license: None

files: concurrent-1.3.4-zimbra-1.0.0.jar (modified with our bug fix)

notes: Concurrency library has been integrated into JDK 1.5.0, but the
       class names are different.  When we are committed to 1.5 we
       should remove this dependency.<p>

       Do I need a license to use it? Can I get one?  No!
       http://gee.cs.oswego.edu/dl/classes/EDU/oswego/cs/dl/util/concurrent/intro.html

product: Perl libraries

vendor: cpan.org

license: Perl (Artistic and GPL)

text: perl.txt gpl.txt

files: IO-stringy-1.220.tar.gz Convert-ASN1-0.18.tar.gz
       libwww-perl-5.800.tar.gz MailTools-1.62.tar.gz
       Date-Calc-5.4.tar.gz MIME-Lite-3.01.tar.gz
       DBD-mysql-2.9004.tar.gz MIME-tools-5.411.tar.gz
       DBD-mysql-2.9005_3.tar.gz Net-Telnet-3.03.tar.gz
       DBI-1.43.tar.gz perl-ldap-0.3202.tar.gz DBI-1.47.tar.gz
       SOAP-Lite-0.55.tar.gz DBI-1.48.tar.gz
       Device-SerialPort-1.000002.tar.gz TimeDate-1.16.tar.gz
       Time-HiRes-1.65.tar.gz HTML-Parser-3.36.tar.gz URI-1.31.tar.gz
       HTML-Tagset-3.03.tar.gz XML-Parser-2.34.tar.gz
       HTTP-Parser-0.02.tar.gz

notes: we do not ship perl, just the libraries we know won't be there
       on a Linux distro or we think will be outdated

product: dom4j

vendor: dom4j.org

license: BSD + more

text: dom4j.txt

files: dom4j-1.5.jar

notes: although dom4j includes GNU jaxp (GPL) and saxproject.org
       licenses (public domain), we end up using dom4j+sax (server)
       and dom4j+jaxen (test harness) only.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: jaxen

vendor: jaxen.org

license: BSD

text: jaxen.txt

files: jaxen-1.1-beta-3.jar

notes: java xpath engine, used by soap test harness

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: amavisd-new

vendor: http://www.ijs.si/ software/amavisd/

license: GPL

text: gpl.txt

files: big perl script

notes: postfix add on content filter MTA than can host other Spam and
       A/V scanners.

files: perl server/client

product: apache

license: Apache 2.0

text: apache2.txt

files: apache-2.0.xx.tar.gz

notes: apache server for 3rd party and native code integration (virus
       checking, content conversion, spell check)

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: PHP

vendor: php.net

license: PHP License v3.0

text: php.txt

files: php-5.x.x.tar.gz

notes: PHP for 3rd party and native code integration (spell check).
       License requires acknowledgement, see restriction 6.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: curl

vendor: http://curl.haxx.se/

license: MIT like

text: curl.txt

notes: our saslauthd backend links against libcurl for HTTP/S from C
       code into ZimbraServer

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: cyrus-sasl

vendor: http://asg.web.cmu.edu/sasl/

license: BSD like

text: cyrus-sasl.txt

notes: we modify cyrus-sasl (saslauthd specifically) to include
       authenticating against Zimbra server

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: libxml2

vendor: http://xmlsoft.org/

license: MIT like

text: libxml2.txt

notes: our saslauthd backend uses libxml2 to parse SOAP from
       ZimbraServer

----------------------------------------------------------------------

product: rrdtool/mrtg

vendor: http://people.ee.ethz.ch/~oetiker/webtools/

license: GPL

text: gpl.txt

notes: perl programs invoked from cron and our monitoring scripts
